classes.name: Logger
classes.description: A Logger object is used to log messages for a specific system or application component. Loggers are normally named using a hierarchical dot-separated namespace. Logger names can be arbitrary strings, but should normally be based on the package name or class name.

methods.name: getLogger
methods.description: Find or create a logger for a named subsystem. If a logger has already been created with the given name it is returned. Otherwise a new logger is created.

methods.name: getLogger

params.name: resourceBundleName
params.description: Name of ResourceBundle to be used for localizing messages

methods.description: Find or create a logger for a named subsystem with a resource bundle.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Log an INFO message. If the logger is currently enabled for the INFO message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: warning
methods.description: Log a WARNING message. If the logger is currently enabled for the WARNING message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: severe
methods.description: Log a SEVERE message. If the logger is currently enabled for the SEVERE message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: config
methods.description: Log a CONFIG message. If the logger is currently enabled for the CONFIG message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: fine
methods.description: Log a FINE message. FINE is a message level providing tracing information. If the logger is currently enabled for the FINE message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: finer
methods.description: Log a FINER message. FINER indicates a fairly detailed tracing message. If the logger is currently enabled for the FINER message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: finest
methods.description: Log a FINEST message. FINEST indicates a highly detailed tracing message. If the logger is currently enabled for the FINEST message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: log

params.name: level
params.description: One of the message level identifiers, e.g., SEVERE

methods.description: Log a message at a specified level. If the logger is currently enabled for the given message level then the given message is forwarded to all the registered output Handler objects.

methods.name: log

params.name: level
params.description: One of the message level identifiers

methods.description: Log a message, with associated Throwable information.

methods.name: setLevel

params.name: newLevel
params.description: The new value for the log level (may be null)

methods.description: Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this logger. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.

methods.name: getLevel

returns.description: The effective level for this logger

methods.description: Get the log Level that has been specified for this Logger. The result may be null, which means that this logger's effective level will be inherited from its parent.

methods.name: isLoggable

returns.description: True if the given message level is currently being logged

methods.description: Check if a message of the given level would actually be logged by this logger. This check is based on the Logger's effective level, which may be inherited from its parent.

methods.name: addHandler
methods.description: Add a log Handler to receive logging messages.

methods.name: removeHandler
methods.description: Remove a log Handler.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Get the name for this logger.

classes.name: Level
classes.description: The Level class defines a set of standard logging levels that can be used to control logging output. The logging Level objects are ordered and specified by ordered integers.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Return the non-localized string name of the Level.

methods.name: intValue
methods.description: Get the integer value for this level. This integer value can be used for efficient ordering comparisons between Level objects.

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parse a level name string into a Level. The argument may be either a level name or an integer value.

fields.name: OFF
fields.description: OFF is a special level that can be used to turn off logging. This level is initialized to Integer.MAX_VALUE.

fields.name: SEVERE
fields.description: SEVERE is a message level indicating a serious failure. In general SEVERE messages should describe events that are of considerable importance and which will prevent normal program execution.

fields.name: WARNING
fields.description: WARNING is a message level indicating a potential problem.

fields.name: INFO
fields.description: INFO is a message level for informational messages.

fields.name: CONFIG
fields.description: CONFIG is a message level for static configuration messages.

fields.name: FINE
fields.description: FINE is a message level providing tracing information.

fields.name: FINER
fields.description: FINER indicates a fairly detailed tracing message.

fields.name: FINEST
fields.description: FINEST indicates a highly detailed tracing message.

fields.name: ALL
fields.description: ALL indicates that all messages should be logged. This level is initialized to Integer.MIN_VALUE.

classes.name: Handler
classes.description: A Handler object takes log messages from a Logger and exports them. It might for example, write them to a console or write them to a file, or send them to a network logging service, or forward them to an OS log, or whatever.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publish a LogRecord. The logging request was made initially to a Logger object, which initialized the LogRecord and forwarded it here.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flush any buffered output.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Close the Handler and free all associated resources.

methods.name: setLevel

params.name: newLevel
params.description: The new value for the log level

methods.description: Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this Handler. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.

methods.name: getLevel

returns.description: The level of messages being logged

methods.description: Get the log level specifying which messages will be logged by this Handler.

classes.name: ConsoleHandler
classes.description: This Handler publishes log records to System.err. By default the SimpleFormatter is used to generate brief summaries.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publish a LogRecord. The logging request was made initially to a Logger object, which initialized the LogRecord and forwarded it here.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Override StreamHandler.close to do a flush but not to close the output stream. That is, we do not close System.err.

classes.name: FileHandler
classes.description: Simple file logging Handler. The FileHandler can either write to a specified file, or it can write to a rotating set of files.

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern for naming the output file

constructors.description: Initialize a FileHandler to write to the given filename.

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern for naming the output file

constructors.description: Initialize a FileHandler to write to the given filename, with optional append.
